tags: no amount of shitty writing will stop me from shipping them
summary: "I owe them (Sansa and Arya) the truth." "Even if the truth destroys us?" "It won't." This is actually my favourite Jonerys line...
caption:
“I owe them (Sansa and Arya) the truth.”
“Even if the truth destroys us?”
“It won’t.”

This is actually my favourite Jonerys line from this season because I think it showed Jon really had faith in their relationship, that it can withstand anything. The way Kit delivered the line with so much assurance, that Jon was not going to let anything get in the way of them. He’s a family man so he didn’t want to keep anything from his sisters/cousins, and he also wasn’t aware of how much of a conniving snake Sansa is.He didn’t know anything about playing the game. All he knew was that he loved Daenerys and his family and that they could work things out, “we can live together.”

Of course, I know that absolutely NOTHING this season made any sense:
- Jon stopping by Dragonstone first before heading to Kingslanding because he was worried about Daenerys’ well-being after losing Missandei and Rhaegal. “How is she? She shouldn’t be alone” but when he comes to comfort Daenerys and tells her he loves her, he couldn’t be physically affectionate with her, which I fully understand why. He was having a hard time having a physical relationship with her after finding out they were related but it doesn’t mean he didn’t love her. Maybe we don’t know how that scene really ended, maybe he stayed and said some words of comfort. The editing along with the writing really sucked this season, only God knows how many scenes they deleted.
- When Tyrion was attempting to convince Jon about killing Daenerys but Jon was constantly defending her, “You think our house words is stamped on our bodies when we are born and that’s who we are? Then I’d be fire and blood too.” He was trying to justify everything Daenerys had done, even by going against his own morals. When Tyrion mentioned his sisters, specifically Sansa, first thing Jon said was “She doesn’t get to choose” which ironically are the same words Daenerys said that convinced Jon she was too far gone and was indeed becoming dangerous. *facepaaaalm*

So anyway, I’m not even going to try and make a sense out of this season, not going to waste my energy on it since the writers clearly did not give a fuck.
All I know is that Jon and Dany loved each other through it all and they deserved so much better.

summary: Apparently Sansa didn’t even apologize for telling Jon’s secret but apologized bc she couldn’t free him and have him rule the...
question: Apparently Sansa didn’t even apologize for telling Jon’s secret but apologized bc she couldn’t free him and have him rule the north which makes thier whole conversation make sense now. And Jon was right to say that the north is free thanks to her and not him and she should be the one ruling. Really the only smart thing jon said all season
answer: Makes a lot of sense because she said ‘the North lost its king.’ Dunno why they made it vague but I prefer it over Sansa apologising for talking to Tyrion because she did the right thing

reblog.comment: Makes a lot of sense because she said ‘the North lost its king.’ Dunno why they made it vague but I prefer it over Sansa apologising for talking to Tyrion because she did the right thing

summary: Game of Thrones: Targaryen History Reveals Jon Snow Was Never Meant To Be King
title: Game of Thrones: Targaryen History Reveals Jon Snow Was Never Meant To Be King
excerpt: Sorry, Snow fans... a look back at Targaryen history means that dark-haired Jon Snow would never be King on Game of Thrones.
description: The few dark-haired Targaryens didn’t get to be rulers of Westeros. However Jon ended up better off than most of the other atypical-looking Targaryens.

as a discord roleplay for game of thrones set in between episodes 2 and 3 of season 8, this server is welcoming, fun, and very interesting! play as a canon character or even create an oc of your own to interact with the main ones!


join today and have fun! https://discord.gg/kTeBVTB

summary:
Mobile cut off my full response so:
I think most likely she would’ve had to give Jon up and Ned would have raised him the exact...
body:
Mobile cut off my full response so:

I think most likely she would’ve had to give Jon up and Ned would have raised him the exact same way, claiming him as his bastard while Lyanna lived as queen in King’s Landing.

The only way she could have raised him is if she somehow heard about Rickard and Brandon’s deaths and gone back to Winterfell before the Rebellion was in full swing, only discovering she’s pregnant AFTER returning. Even then, there are so many variables.

Aerys would have to die somehow. Otherwise he’d have had every Starks’ head.

Rhaegar would have to decide to let them stay up North since Jon isn’t the Visenya he’d been hoping for. He may or may not publicly claim him.

Robert would have to decide he didn’t want to marry her anymore because she’d been ‘defiled’ - given his obsession with her, I find this unlikely. Maybe Rhaegar breaks their betrothal by royal decree. Maybe not.

It’s just. A lot. And so unlikely. But that’s what fanworks are for.

blog.name: frazzledsoul
blog.title: I Am The Elephant In The Room
blog.description: Currently lost in the GoT AO3 fanfic archive.

summary: Does it ever make you sad to realize that we could have had three of the principal characters of GoT happily settled into their...
body:
Does it ever make you sad to realize that we could have had three of the principal characters of GoT happily settled into their chosen fates (Sansa Queen of the North, Dany Queen of Everything Else, Jon voluntarily relieved of all titles and running free in the North with his friends) with minimal bloodshed and absolutely no firebombing or girlfraunticide?

Jaime and Brienne could be happily retired and living in Tarth?

Arya and Gendry out having adventures TOGETHER?

A small council full of people who actually knew what they were doing?

We got so close.

reblog.comment:

Jaime and Brienne could be happily retired and living in Tarth?

Arya and Gendry out having adventures TOGETHER?

A small council full of people who actually knew what they were doing?

We got so close.

Jaime and Brienne could be happily retired and living in Tarth?

Arya and Gendry out having adventures TOGETHER?

A small council full of people who actually knew what they were doing?

We got so close.
trail.content:
Does it ever make you sad to realize that we could have had three of the principal characters of GoT happily settled into their chosen fates (Sansa Queen of the North, Dany Queen of Everything Else, Jon voluntarily relieved of all titles and running free in the North with his friends) with minimal bloodshed and absolutely no firebombing or girlfraunticide?

Jaime and Brienne could be happily retired and living in Tarth?

Arya and Gendry out having adventures TOGETHER?

A small council full of people who actually knew what they were doing?

We got so close.
